Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http

Class HTTPServer

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connector
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Server
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.HTTPServer
Direct Known Subclasses:
FileHTTPServer, PriorityAwareHTTPConnector, PriorityAwareHTTPServer, ServletServer
public class HTTPServer extends Server
Connection factory for HTTP connections on a given port. Provides default HTTPConnection instances with 404 behaviour.
Author:
Chris Burdess

    • port

    • framePadding

      protected int framePadding
      HTTP/2 frame padding amount for server-originated frames. Padding can be used to obscure the actual size of DATA, HEADERS, and PUSH_PROMISE frames for security purposes (RFC 7540 Section 6.1). Value must be between 0-255 bytes.

    • getFramePadding

      public int getFramePadding()
      Gets the HTTP/2 frame padding amount for server-originated frames.
      Returns:
      padding amount in bytes (0-255)

    • setFramePadding

      public void setFramePadding(int framePadding)
      Sets the HTTP/2 frame padding amount for server-originated frames. Padding adds random-length padding to DATA, HEADERS, and PUSH_PROMISE frames to obscure actual message sizes for security purposes.

      From RFC 7540 Section 6.1: "Padding can be added to DATA, HEADERS, PUSH_PROMISE frames to obscure the size of messages and to provide protection against specific attacks."

      Parameters:
      framePadding - padding amount in bytes (0-255)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if padding is outside valid range

    • setAuthenticationProvider

      public void setAuthenticationProvider(HTTPAuthenticationProvider provider)
      Sets the authentication provider for this server.
      Parameters:
      provider - the authentication provider, or null to disable authentication

    • getAuthenticationProvider

      public HTTPAuthenticationProvider getAuthenticationProvider()

      Returns:
      the authentication provider, or null if authentication is not configured

    • setHandlerFactory

      public void setHandlerFactory(HTTPRequestHandlerFactory factory)
      Sets the handler factory for this server.

      The factory is called once per HTTP stream when the initial request headers are received. It can examine the headers (including :method, :path, etc.) to decide which handler implementation to return.

      If no factory is set, requests receive a 404 Not Found response.

      Parameters:
      factory - the handler factory, or null to use default 404 behaviour
      See Also:
      • HTTPRequestHandlerFactory

    • getHandlerFactory

      public HTTPRequestHandlerFactory getHandlerFactory()
      Returns the handler factory for this server.
      Returns:
      the handler factory, or null if not configured
